Create a YAML file for the MIP scenario

Source: R/yaml.R
mip_write_yaml.Rd

This function creates a YAML file with the specified parameters for the MIP case/scenario.

Usage

mip_write_yaml(
  usensys_dir = NULL,
  yaml_file = file.path(usensys_dir, "mip_case.yml"),
  title = "MIP case settings for the USENSYS model",
  case_id = "CASE ID-NAME (REQUIRED)",
  case_description = "CASE_DESCRIPTION (OPTIONAL)",
  input_idx = c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6),
  YEARS = c(2027, 2030, 2035, 2040, 2045, 2050),
  group_techs = FALSE,
  group_fuels = FALSE,
  use_short_names = TRUE,
  invcost = FALSE,
  correct_declining_bounds = TRUE,
  drop_ver_no_cf = TRUE,
  drop_cf_no_techs = TRUE,
  drop_zero_capacity_no_build = TRUE,
  vintage = FALSE,
  calendar = "w52_h168",
  subset_weeks = 0,
  SDR = 0.02,
  WACC = 0.05,
  ESR = TRUE,
  lostload = TRUE,
  optimize_storage_duration = TRUE,
  storage_full_year = FALSE,
  early_retirement = FALSE,
  CO2_cap_national = FALSE,
  CO2_cap_regional = TRUE,
  offshore_wind_min_capacity = TRUE,
  backstop = TRUE,
  RAMP = FALSE,
  myopic = TRUE,
  solver = "energyRt::solver_options$gams_gdx_cplex_barrier",
  overwrite = FALSE,
  print_level = 1
)

Arguments

yaml_file

character: The name of the YAML file to create

title

character: The title of the YAML file

case_id

character: The name of the case/scenario, required field in further processing of the YAML file

case_description

character: The description of the case/scenario

input_idx

numeric: The indices of the input folders to use (Inputs_p* in the GenX Inputs folder)

YEARS

numeric: The actual years in the input folders

group_techs

logical: If TRUE, removes the zone identifier from the technology name

group_fuels

logical: If TRUE, removes the zone identifier from the fuel name

use_short_names

logical: If TRUE (recommended), uses short names for technologies and fuels

invcost

logical: If TRUE, overnight investment costs will be used from the GenX input files to calculate annualized costs, if FALSE, the annualized costs are used directly from the GenX input files (default)

vintage

logical: (experimental!) If TRUE, year identifiers are added to the technology names

calendar

character: The calendar settings ("w52_h168" used in all MIP cases)

subset_weeks

numeric: The number of weeks to subset (0 for automatic detection)

SDR

numeric: The social discount rate (used in perfect foresight scenarios), default is 0.02 (2%) in all MIP cases

WACC

numeric: The weighted average cost of capital, default is 0.05 (5%) in all MIP cases

ESR

logical: If TRUE, the Renewable Portfolio Standard (RPS) is used as a policy, used in the current policy scenarios

lostload

numeric: The lost load penalty in $/MWh (default is 500)

CO2_cap_national

logical: If TRUE, a national CO2 cap is used

CO2_cap_regional

logical: If TRUE, a regional CO2 cap is used, used in the MIP current policy scenarios

offshore_wind_min_capacity

logical: If TRUE, the offshore wind minimum capacity requirement constraint added

backstop

numeric: The backstop price in $/CO2-ton (default is 200)

RAMP

logical: (optional) If TRUE, the ramping constraints are used

myopic

logical: If TRUE, the myopic solution is used, if FALSE, the perfect

solver

character: The solver settings in energyRt format (default is "energyRt::solver_options$gams_gdx_cplex_barrier")

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
mip_write_yaml("mip_case.yaml")
} # }
